name: Chicken Parmesan Burgers
author: Daymazing
summary: My boyfriend enjoys chicken Parmesan, and I was feeling a light burger, so I created this masterpiece! Feel free to use homemade bread or garlic bread instead of store-bought - I just used what I had on hand.
ingredients: 4 small skinless, boneless chicken breasts, cubed
directions: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
Combine chicken breasts, parsley, oregano, basil, salt, and pepper in a food processor; process into a smooth paste
Shape chicken mixture into 2 round patties
Mix bread crumbs and Parmesan cheese together in a shallow bowl
Dredge patties to coat both sides
Arrange on an ungreased baking sheet
Spread 1 1/2 teaspoon butter over each slice of bread; sprinkle remaining bread crumb-Parmesan mixture on top
Arrange near the chicken patties on the baking sheet
Bake in the preheated oven until bread is browned, 10 to 15 minutes
Transfer bread to a serving plate
Continue baking chicken until an instant-read thermometer inserted into the center reads 165 degrees F (74 degrees C), 10 to 15 minutes more
Melt remaining 2 tablespoons butter in a saucepan
Cook and stir onion and garlic in the butter until onion is translucent, about 5 minutes
Add mushrooms and flour; cook and stir until starting to brown, about 5 minutes
Stir in spaghetti sauce; simmer until thickened, 5 to 10 minutes
Place a chicken patty in the center; cover with remaining bread slices
